sen.j: 三室戸 和光（みむろど まさみつ、天保13年11月9日 (旧暦)（1842年12月10日） - 大正11年（1922年））は、江戸時代末期の公卿。
sen.e: Masamitsu MIMURODO (December 10, 1842 - 1922) was a Kugyo (high court noble), who lived during the end of Edo Period
Masamitsu MIMURODO (December 10, 1842 - 1922) was a Kugyo (high court noble)in the end of Edo Period.
sen.cmt: 前置詞duringは不適切です。ピリオドが漏れています。
sen.e: Masamitsu MIMURODO (December 10, 1842 - 1922) was a Kugyo (high court noble)in the end of Edo Period.

sen.j: 三室戸家七代目三室戸陳光の嫡男、明治になり子爵、従二位、伊勢神宮大宮司。
sen.e: He was the eldest legitimate son of the 7th head of Mimurodo family, Katamitsu MIMURODO, and in the Meiji Period he was conferred the title of viscount ranked Junii (Junior Second Rank) and served as the chief priest of Ise-jingu Shrine.

He was the eldest legitimate son of the 7th head of the Mimurodo family, Katamitsu MIMURODO, and in the Meiji Period he was conferred the title of viscount, was granted Junii (Junior Second Rank) and served as the chief priest of Ise-jingu Shrine.
sen.cmt: familyに冠詞をつけます。子爵位と従二位の授与を分けて表現します。
sen.e: He was the eldest legitimate son of the 7th head of the Mimurodo family, Katamitsu MIMURODO, and in the Meiji Period he was conferred the title of viscount, was granted Junii (Junior Second Rank) and served as the chief priest of Ise-jingu Shrine.

sen.j: 継嗣となるはずだった六代三室戸雄光の子三室戸治光が平安神宮の宮司となる。
sen.e: The 6th family head, Takemitsu MIMURODO's son, Harumitsu MIMURODO, who was supposed to be the heir, became the Guji (chief of those who serves shrine, controls festivals and general affairs) of Heian-jingu Shrine.

Harumitsu MIMURODO, a son of the 6th family head Takemitsu MIMURODO, who was supposed to be the heir, became the Guji (chief of those who serves shrine, controls festivals and general affairs) of Heian-jingu Shrine.
sen.cmt: 事実関係が分かりやすいように文構造を整理します。
sen.e: Harumitsu MIMURODO, a son of the 6th family head Takemitsu MIMURODO, who was supposed to be the heir, became the Guji (chief of those who serves shrine, controls festivals and general affairs) of Heian-jingu Shrine.

sen.j: 各地の石碑に揮毫が残っている。
sen.e: In various places, there are stone monuments that conserve his lapidary calligraphy showing his brushstroke.
sen.cmt: 揮毫→定訳不明：calligraphy showing his brushstrokeとしました。
sen.e: In various places, there are stone monuments that conserve his lapidary calligraphy showing his brushstroke.
In various places, there are stone monuments that conserve his lapidary calligraphy showing his brushstroke.

sen.j: 三室戸家は藤原氏北家真夏流日野家柳原庶流とされ、初め北小路を称したが寛文5年 （1665年）、願いにより三室戸を家名とした。
sen.e: The Mimurodo family was be a branch line of the Yanagihara family originally from the Hino Family, descendent from the Manatsu line, the Hokke (Hoku Family) of the Fujiwara clan, and at first the family used the name 'Kitakoji' but in 1665, at the request of the family, it was allowed to change the family name to 'Mimurodo.'

The Mimurodo family was considered to be a branch line of the Yanagihara family originated from the Hino Family, descendent from the Manatsu line, the Hokke (Hoku Family) of the Fujiwara clan, and at first the family used the name 'Kitakoji' but in 1665, at the request of the family, it was allowed to change the family name to 'Mimurodo.'
sen.cmt: 「…とされ」を訳出します。Originally from…という表現は曖昧ですので言い換えます。
sen.e: The Mimurodo family was considered to be a branch line of the Yanagihara family originated from the Hino Family, descendent from the Manatsu line, the Hokke (Hoku Family) of the Fujiwara clan, and at first the family used the name 'Kitakoji' but in 1665, at the request of the family, it was allowed to change the family name to 'Mimurodo.'

sen.j: また「和光」の読みを「かずみつ」と読むのは誤記。
sen.e: His name 和光 sometimes reads 'Kazumitsu,' but this reading is erroneous.
sen.cmt: 「和光」→’his name 和光 ’と名前の漢字表記を加えました。読み→reading
sen.e: His name (和光) sometimes reads 'Kazumitsu,' but this reading is erroneous.
sen.cmt: 日本語をそのまま英語の地の文に入れるのは不適切だと考えましたので、かっこに入れます。
sen.e: His name (和光) sometimes reads 'Kazumitsu,' but this reading is erroneous.
